example-games.name: Kinect Sports - Boxing
example-games.gameplay: Players punch in the air to attack the opponent (either another player or a computer opponent) or hold both arms in front of face to defend.

example-games.name: Kinect Sports - Table Tennis Paddle Panic
example-games.gameplay: Player hits the continuously incoming Ping-Pong balls by swinging arms as if they were holding paddles in both hands.

example-games.name: Kinect Adventures - Rally Ball
example-games.gameplay: Players use limbs and head to hit virtual rally balls towards the boxes and targets located at the end of a virtual hallway; with each target dismantled, additional balls are projected back to be hit.

example-games.name: Body Brain Connection - Traffic Control
example-games.gameplay: Player holds out both arms as bridges to guide multiple cars and trucks moving on platforms to the destinations designated by the vehicle's color.

example-games.name: Wii Fit - Table Tilt
example-games.gameplay: Players shift weight on a balance board in all directions (front-and-back and side-to-side) to tilt a table and guide marbles through holes.

example-games.name: Kinect Sports - Table Tennis
example-games.gameplay: Player stands and swings one arm to play table tennis with another player or a computer opponent.

example-games.name: Wii Fit - Balance Bubble
example-games.gameplay: Player's avatar stands in a bubble that runs along a stream. Players shift weight front and back to control the speed of the bubble and shift weight from side to side to steer the bubble; the goal is to reach the finish line while avoiding the riverbank and other obstacles (e.g. a flying bee).

example-games.name: Wii Fit - Soccer Heading
example-games.gameplay: Players shift weight from side to side to head soccer balls that are kicked in, while avoiding hitting foils.

example-games.name: Kinect Adventures - 20,000 Leaks
example-games.gameplay: The player's avatar is in a glass cube underwater. The player positions limbs and head to plug cracks as crabs, fish, and sharks hit the cube; if multiple cracks appear, the player has to plug all of them at the same time.

example-games.name: Wii Fit - Penguin Slide
example-games.gameplay: Players shift weight from side to side to tilt an iceberg and let a penguin that slides on it catch fish jumping out from the water.

example-games.name: Kinect Sports - Soccer Target Kick
example-games.gameplay: Players kick virtual soccer balls to hit the targets that are protected by a goalie.

example-games.name: Wii Sports Resort - Swordplay-Speed Slice
example-games.gameplay: Players swing the Wii remote in the direction specified on an object when it appears to cut the object.

example-games.name: Wii Sports - Bowling
example-games.gameplay: Players play a virtual bowling game against up to three other players or computer opponents.

example-games.name: Minute to Win it - Bucket Head
example-games.gameplay: Players throw virtual Ping-Pong balls to a wall and catch the rebounding balls using a virtual bucket strapped on head.

example-games.name: Wii Sports - Golf
example-games.gameplay: Players play a virtual golf game using the Wii Remote.

example-games.name: Wii Sports or Kinect Sports - Bowling
example-games.gameplay: Players play a virtual bowling game against up to three other players.

example-games.name: Kinect Sports - Bowling
example-games.gameplay: Players play a virtual bowling game against up to three other players.

example-games.name: Kinect Adventures - River Rush
example-games.gameplay: The player's avatar stands on a raft that is moving down a river. The player steps left and right and jumps to control the raft in order to collect points scattered throughout the river.

example-games.name: Wii Fit - Obstacle Course
example-games.gameplay: Players walk in-place and 'jump' (bend and then extend knees) to control the avatar through various obstacles.

example-games.name: Dance Central 3
example-games.gameplay: Players move their body to dance along to the song and try to follow the movement instructions on the screen.

example-games.name: Kinect Sports - Soccer
example-games.gameplay: Player plays the active soccer player to pass the ball, shoot the ball, and intercept shots at goal (as a goalie).

example-games.name: Wii Fit - Ski Jump
example-games.gameplay: Player skis downhill and is asked to 'jump' (bend and then straighten knees) at a certain point.
